I would like to express my ultimate opposition to the proposed increase. Firstly, it
is way above any reasonable inflation rates. In most services in life, an increase
of fees can be expected but normally around the current inflation rates, as does
our incomes. If USCIS need extra money to improve the service, it should be
sought from other funding sources other than putting more responsibilities on the
people who are struggling with the already high costs of immigration.

I?ll give an example of my situation, I currently work on H1-B visa which means
that my spouse is not allowed to work, so I am the sole supporter of my family of
4. No trying to get a GC .. I have to come up with so many costs... the lawyer fee
alone is around $6000 plus all the extra application and medical costs.

No imagine how much this new fee increase would do to me ?... the increase for
I-485 from $325 to $905 would mean a huge burden for me. The cost for the GC?s
would be $3620 ? that is an increase of $2320 .. how easy would that be for me
and my family?

Please re-consider your proposal...

Thank you for listening...
